sentence.Network_en: "It's" (with an apostrophe) should be used only as a contraction for "it is".
sentence.Network_cn: it's（带撇号）只能用作itis的缩约形式。

sentence.Network_cn: 这里应该有一个撇号，还有你看，你把men这个单词整个儿漏掉了！

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting the omission of one or more letters): via late Latin, from Greek apostrophos 'accent of elision', from apostrephein 'turn away', from apo 'from' + strephein 'to turn'
mid 16th cent.: via Latin from Greek apostrophē 'turning away', from apostrephein 'turn away' (see apostrophe)

entry.tran: 撇号，省字号，所有格符号（符号为’）
entry.def: An apostrophe is the mark ' when it is written to indicate that one or more letters have been left out of a word, as in 'isn't' and 'we'll'. It is also added to nouns to form possessives, as in 'Mike's car'.

means.word_mean: 1. address to an absent or imaginary person
2. the mark (') used to indicate the omission of one or more letters from a printed word
